title: 107_hr2774
content: The "Renewable Energy Loan Guarantee Act of 2001" may be cited as the Act. It provides loan guarantees for renewable energy sources. Definitions for the Renewable Energy Source Facility Guaranteed Loan Program include the Loan Guarantee Board, incremental hydropower, the Program itself, and qualified renewable energy source facilities. The Renewable Energy Source Facility Guaranteed Loan Program establishes a Loan Guarantee Board to provide loan guarantees for qualified renewable energy source facilities. The Board is composed of the Secretary of Energy, Secretary of Commerce, Chairman of the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System, and Secretary of the Treasury. The Program may guarantee loans for qualified renewable energy source facilities by private banking and investment institutions. The total guarantee limit is $750,000,000, and the Board ensures small businesses receive appropriate loan guarantees. The Board must approve or deny guarantee applications promptly. The Board may approve or deny loan guarantee applications for qualified renewable energy source facilities promptly. Loan guarantees are issued if credit is not available under reasonable terms, and there is a reasonable assurance of repayment based on the owner or operator's earning power and security pledged. Loan guarantees under this section require security pledged for repayment assurance, with interest rates determined by the Board. All guaranteed loans must be fully repaid by December 31, 2025, and terms cannot be amended without Board consent. Commitment to issue a loan guarantee must include loan security. Loan guarantees under this section require security for repayment assurance. The owner of a renewable energy facility must pay a fee to the Treasury Department. Audits by the General Accounting Office are required before and during the loan guarantee period. Once every 2 years, the owner or operator of the facility must report to Congress on the activities of the Board until the guaranteed loan is fully repaid.
